oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ASSESSING A COST-EFFICIENT METHODOLOGY FOR LONG TERM WAVE COMPUTATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Besio, Giovanni
Leo, Francesco De
Orfila, Alejandro
Enriquez, Alejandra
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We compare two approaches for the computation of return period wave in shallow waters: 1) Perform Extreme Value Analysis (EVA) on offshore wave data and propagate design waves toward the coast (approach referred to as DW-EVM), and 2) Propagate the whole time-series to the coast first, then compute EVA on the downscaled data (referred to as SW-EVM).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 37 (2022): Proceedings of 37th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 2022; management.82
